Jeremić: Osnovni zadatak Narodne stranke je vraćanje morala u politiku

04 Nov 2019, 11:55

Predsednik Narodne stranke Vuk Jeremić izjavio je danas da će opozicija bojkotom predstojećih "lažnih izbora" pokazati gradjanima spremnost na žrtvu i da joj nije stalo samo do ličnih privilegija."Politika i etika su danas u Srbiji duboko zavadjene. Svaki pristup ozdravljenju društva suštinski mora da se zasniva na povratku morala u politiku. To je ono na čemu je nastala Narodna stranka i ono za šta ćemo se zalagati u godinama koje su pred nama", rekao je Jeremić televiziji N1.Jeremić je naveo da je apatija u društvu jedan od najvećih problema zbog kojih nije lako zamisliti brzu promenu vlasti, i podsetio na reči jednog francuskog mislioca da "narod nikada ne gubi snagu, već samo volju".Predsednik Narodne stranke je ocenio da je značajan deo gradjana izgubio volju."Da bismo narodu vratili volju, moramo povratiti veru, odnosno poverenje. Bojkot je apsolutno neophodan i da bi gradjani videli da u opoziciji postoje ljudi koji se bave politikom ne samo zarad sopstvenih privilegija, poslaničkih ili odborničkih mesta i nekakvih apanaža, već da su spremni da podele sudbinu naroda i idu težim putem, umesto da za nadoknadu učestvuju u tragičnom cirkusu kao što su 'pinkovski' izbori i sednice sadašnjeg parlamenta", rekao je Jeremić.Jeremić je istakao da je bojkot "lažnih izbora" preduslov da se dodje do normalnih izbora, i dodao da sistem ne može da promeni onaj ko je spreman da parazitira u njemu, te da na predstojećim izborima neće učestvovati niko ko nije u direktnom dogovoru sa režimom.Predsednik Narodne stranke je rekao da bi potpis na sporazum o "razgraničenju" sa Kosovom i Metohijom, o kojem pregovara predsednik Srbije Aleksandar Vučić i koji predvidja stolicu Prištine u UN, predstavljao akt veleizdaje i priznanje južne srpske pokrajine kao nezavisne države."Režimski mediji će pokušati da predstave da kosovska stolica u UN ne znači priznanje, što je najveća laž. Može Vučić da govori da je crno belo, ali to znači priznanje. Kosovu je potrebno još samo članstvo u UN da bi zaokružilo svoj medjunarodno-pravni subjektivitet", naveo je Jeremić.Jeremić je rekao da Narodna stranka nije protiv pregovora sa Albancima, ali se apsolutno protivi potpisivanju akta kojim bi Srbija otpisala svoj suverenitet nad teritorijom Kosova i Metohije i kojim bi Priština dobila punopravno članstvo u UN."Mi bismo razgovarali sa kosovskim Albancima i sa njima pokušali da rešimo more zajedničkih problema, da uspostavimo ekonomsku saradnju, koja danas ide isključivo preko kriminalaca sa severa Kosova, naučnu i kulturnu saradnju i obezbedimo uslove za normalan život na ovim prostorima, bez obzira što se ne možemo složiti o statusu", rekao je Jeremić.Dodao je da bi trebalo pokazati strpljenje i čvrstinu kako bi kosovski Albanci shvatili da u Beogradu niko nikada neće biti spreman da im prizna nezavisnost i da bi tek tada "pragmatizam obe strane naložio da se govori o nečemu što ima smisla".Jeremić je, povodom jučerašnje Skupštine Narodne stranke, rekao da su usvojeni programi o ekonomiji, poljoprivredi, kulturi i dijaspori, čija bi primena trebalo da počne prvog dana po promeni vlasti."Očekivanja gradjana posle promene vlasti biće mnogo veća nego 5. oktobra i tada neće biti vremena da se smišlja šta i kako činiti. Sada je vreme da se planira kako podići Srbiju iz pepela", rekao je Jeremić.

Jeremic: The main task of the People's Party is to restore morality in politics

04 Nov 2019, 11:55

People's Party Chairman Vuk Jeremic said today that by boycotting the upcoming "false elections", citizens will be ready to sacrifice and that they do not care only about personal privileges. "Politics and ethics are deeply entrenched in Serbia today. is based on the return of morality to politics. This is what the People's Party is about and what we will stand for in the years ahead, "Jeremic told N1. Jeremic said that apathy in society is one of the biggest problems for which it is not easy to imagine a rapid change of government, and recalled the words of a French thinker that "the people never lose power, but only the will." The President of the People's Party estimated that a significant part of the citizens lost their will. "To restore the will to the people, we must a boycott is absolutely necessary for citizens to see that there are people in the opposition who are engaged in politics not only for their own sake. they are ready to share the destiny of the people and go the hard way instead of participating in a tragic circus such as the 'Pink' elections and the sessions of the current parliament, "Jeremic said. stressed that a boycott of "false elections" is a prerequisite for normal elections, adding that the system cannot be changed by anyone who is willing to parasitize it, and that no one who is not in direct agreement with the regime will participate in the upcoming elections. People's parties said signing a "demarcation" agreement with Kosovo and Metohija, negotiated by Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic and envisioning Pristina's seat at the UN, would be an act of treason and recognition of the southern Serbian province as an independent state. "Regime media will try to imagine that the Kosovo chair in the UN does not mean recognition, which is the biggest lie. Vucic may say it's black and white, but that means recognition. Kosovo only needs UN membership to round out its international legal subjectivity, "Jeremic said. Jeremic said the People's Party is not against negotiating with Albanians, but is absolutely opposed to signing an act that would write off Serbia's sovereignty over Kosovo's territory and Metohija, which would give Pristina full membership of the UN. "We would talk to Kosovo Albanians and try to solve the sea of common problems, to establish economic cooperation, which today goes exclusively through criminals from northern Kosovo, to scientific and cultural cooperation and to secure conditions. for a normal life in this region, regardless of the fact that we cannot agree on the status, "Jeremic said. He added that patience and firmness should be shown in order for the Kosovo Albanians to understand that no one in Belgrade would ever be ready to recognize their independence and that only then would "the pragmatism of both parties order to talk about something that makes sense." of the National Assembly, said programs on economy, agriculture, culture and the diaspora were adopted, whose implementation should start on the first day after the change of government. "The expectations of citizens after the change of government will be much higher than on October 5 and then there will be no time for think of what and how to do. Now is the time to plan how to lift Serbia from the ashes, "Jeremic said.
